text: "If—" is a poem by English Nobel laureate Rudyard Kipling (1865–1936), that was written circa 1895. It was written as a tribute to Leander Starr Jameson. It is a literary example of Victorian-era stoicism. == Text == == References == == Other websites == * on Wikimedia Commons * * Authentic digital editions archive of "If—" * Staging of "If—" as a comic strip * If by Rudyard Kipling on YouTube Category:19th-century British poems Category:Works by Rudyard Kipling Category:1890s works
title: If—
